nodes.bodyText: Removing while iterating? This seems like a very bad plan
This max isn't needed, we just need to use an iterator.
Unneeded final
Update date

nodes.bodyText: Can be final
Can be final, not sure if it's allowed to be static?
Unneeded this, this can be fixed using cleanup actions normally
@szarnekow should this be volatile? i.e. is this accessed in a multithreaded way?
That's the same as Collections.emptyList() right?
Few unneeded this in this file
Same code, just use an iterator
s/expected/Expected/
Useless in Java
Update date

nodes.bodyText: Iterator please
Please also update @EmfAdaptable
More of the same
"ResourceSet is not a ResourceSetImpl" -> "ResourceSet is not an instance of ResourceSetImpl"
Extra ((
Extra ((
If possible, please try to replace the references to the code from xbase.lib. with the Java equivalent.

nodes.bodyText: The code returns immediately after the removal, so it should be ok. EmfAdaptabel should stay like that to avoid unnecessary noise in other generated code.
It's pretty much the coding style that is used in org.eclipse.emf.ecore.util.EcoreUtil.getAdapter(List<Adapter>, Object) - apart from the fact that instanceof is used rather than isAdapterForType
Unnecessary explicit boxing.
I'd prefer a gradual migration towards 'cancellation'  vs 'cancelation' :) We could start with local vars and parameter names.
I don't think so. If the field projectConfig was Optional<IProjectConfig>, the boolean flag could become obsolete. So it's just a locally cached init state.
a plain forLoop for (int i = 0; i < numChunks; i++)  would be better.

No, please don't.
Catfight :)

Meh...
FluentIterable.from(..).filter(..).filter(..) would be easier to read.
